critique: This document is an executive order from 1946 amending a previous executive order to include the Los Angeles Union Stockyards Company under the control of the Secretary of Agriculture. It invokes presidential power under the Constitution, laws of the United States, and specific acts related to selective service and war labor disputes. The order aims to ensure the operation of these facilities. Given the context of the time (post-WWII), this action likely relates to managing resources and labor disputes in key industries. There is no information about immigration. The order expands executive power to control private companies. It centralizes power in the federal government. It does not directly address civil liberties or national security. It involves government intervention in the economy. It does not directly address social inclusion.
